title: Trump stays off script at first Oval Office press conference
shortDescription: President Trump was eager on Monday to point out contrasts with his Democratic predecessor, including a free-wheeling Oval Office press conference.

title: ACLU files lawsuit against Trump order to end birthright citizenship
shortDescription: The ACLU seeks to prevent President Trump from bypassing the 14th Amendment, which granted citizenship to nearly everyone born in the United States

title: Donald Trump kicks off first full day in office: Live updates
shortDescription: Tuesday marks Donald Trump's first full day in office. Keep up with the USA TODAY Network's live coverage on his top priorities for Americans.

title: President Trump signs flurry of executive orders
shortDescription: President Donald Trump signed a flurry of executive orders from the Oval Office addressing a wide range of topics.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump's first full day in office
shortDescription: The 47th president didn't miss a beat in getting his government up and running. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: Donald Trump followed inauguration with flurry of action. Now what?
shortDescription: The 47th president issued a series of executive orders, saw his first Cabinet member confirmed and moved into the White House, all in a day's work.

title: Why does Trump want to change the 14th Amendment and US citizenship?
shortDescription: The 14th Amendment grants citizenship to "all persons born or naturalized in the US"—why does Trump wants to change it?

title: President Trump orders United States to exit WHO
shortDescription: The day-one executive order fulfills a campaign promise. Health experts worry it puts US health at risk.

title: Trump issues executive order to halt TikTok ban – but is it legal?
shortDescription: President Donald Trump issued an executive order aiming to temporarily halt a law requiring TikTok to sell U.S. assets or be banned in the U.S.

title: Trump pardons nearly 1,600 Jan. 6 defendants, a campaign promise
shortDescription: Nearly 1,600 people were charged and about 1,270 people were convicted in the riot.

title: President Trump takes a spin at three inaugural balls
shortDescription: President Donald Trump stopped by the Commander in Chief Ball, Liberty Ball and Starlight Ball, dancing to the same song at each of inaugural gala.

title: Donald Trump's 47th presidency in pictures
shortDescription: Donald Trump was sworn in as the 47th President of the United States on Jan. 20, 2025.

title: Video shows Donald Trump take presidential oath for second time
shortDescription: Trump was sworn back into the White House as the 47th U.S. president Monday at an inauguration ceremony held inside the Rotunda of the U.S. Capitol.

title: Trump supporters brave cold to celebrate: 'Happiest day of my life'
shortDescription: A parade was moved indoors to the Capital One Arena and Trump supporters waited hours to get a chance to mark the start of his second term.

title: Hundreds pledge on MLK Day to defend civil rights under Trump
shortDescription: A rally at a historic Black church celebrated the civil rights legend and included a vow to protect rights under the new administration.

title: Senate committee votes in favor of Hegseth for defense secretary
shortDescription: Hegseth, 44, is a combat veteran and former Fox News host. The committee voted along party lines to advance his nomination to the full Senate.

title: Haitian residents in Ohio city react to Trump, Vance inauguration
shortDescription: Haitians living in Springfield, Ohio, were at the center of the debate over immigration during the 2024 election

title: Analyzing Donald Trump's second inaugural address
shortDescription: What were the key messages from Donald Trump's second inaugural address? USA TODAY's Susan Page analyzes the speech.

title: Trump's hand wasn't on his Bible during swearing-in. Does it matter?
shortDescription: Despite social media attention, the Constitution protects freedom of religion. So putting a hand on a Bible, or even using one at all, isn't required.

title: What Trump got right and wrong about the Panama Canal | Fact check
shortDescription: Trump was wrong about American deaths building the Panama Canal, but right about its cost addressing the topic during his inaugural address

title: Full text of Trump's inaugural address: Read the full transcript
shortDescription: See the full text transcript of Donald Trump's inaugural address after being sworn in as the 47th president of the United States.

title: See President Trump’s inaugural parade
shortDescription: See the pomp and circumstance of the inaugural parade and celebration for President Donald Trump at Capital One Arena.

title: Joe Biden gives presidential goodbye
shortDescription: Joe Biden, with Dr. Jill Biden by his side, told the American people to "stay engaged" during Donald Trump's administration.

title: As Trump is sworn in, celebration and resilience in D.C.
shortDescription: Trump supporters lined up outside Capital One Arena in celebration.

title: Donald Trump enters inauguration to applause
shortDescription: Donald Trump entered the US Capitol Rotunda to applause ahead of becoming the 47th president of the United States.
